decks.notes: The key concept of this deck is to assemble UrzaTron (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This allows the player to cast powerful threats like Karn Liberated, Karn, the Great Creator, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger while also controlling the game with cards like Wurmcoil Engine and Oblivion Stone. The deck aims to quickly establish board control and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats while disrupting their game plan.

This UW Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while taking control of the game through powerful spells like Cryptic Command and Teferi, Time Raveler. It aims to maintain board presence and card advantage by using versatile spells like Snapcaster Mage and Force of Negation. The deck also includes efficient removal options like Path to Exile and Supreme Verdict to handle opposing threats. By utilizing a mix of counterspells, card draw, and removal, this deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a battle of attrition.

The main idea of this Aggro - Red Deck Wins archetype is to deal damage quickly and efficiently using low-cost spells and aggressive creatures to overwhelm the opponent. The deck includes a mix of direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, alongside efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear. The deck also includes burn spells like Boros Charm and Skullcrack to bypass opposing defenses and finish off the opponent. By applying constant pressure and dealing damage consistently, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The main focus of this Aggro - Humans Modern deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. By utilizing powerful Human creatures like Champion of the Parish, Mantis Rider, and Thalia's Lieutenant, the deck aims to quickly build a strong board presence and put pressure on the opponent. Cards like Aether Vial and Noble Hierarch help to accelerate the deployment of creatures, while disruptive elements like Reflector Mage and Meddling Mage can disrupt the opponent's strategy. The mana base of the deck is carefully constructed to support the diverse array of Humans in the deck.

The primary focus of this Modern 1 vs 1 combo Dredge deck is to utilize cards like Cathartic Reunion, Life from the Loam, and Creeping Chill to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Narcomoeba, Prized Amalgam, and Bloodghast. By consistently dredging cards from the graveyard and returning creatures to the battlefield, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of creatures and trigger powerful effects like Creeping Chill and Conflagrate. The deck also includes interaction with cards like Ox of Agonas and Merchant of the Vale to maintain card advantage and consistency.

This deck focuses on assembling the Heliod combo using cards like Walking Ballista, Spike Feeder, and Conclave Mentor to gain infinite life and create an infinitely large creature. Auriok Champion and Skyclave Apparition provide protection and removal, while Ranger-Captain of Eos and Collected Company help find the combo pieces quickly. Utopia Sprawl helps ramp up mana production, allowing for an early combo finish. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with its life gaining and creature size increasing capabilities.

This deck focuses on using aggressive creatures and disruption spells to quickly control the board and pressure opponents. By utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and efficient removal spells like Fatal Push, the goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while efficiently deploying threats like Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger and Magmatic Channeler. The deck also includes versatile cards like Stoneforge Mystic to fetch powerful equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Batterskull to further increase aggression and resilience. With a mix of disruption, aggression, and card advantage, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents and secure victory quickly.

This deck focuses on disrupting opponents' plans with a combination of land destruction (using cards like Pillage and Blood Moon), while accelerating its own mana production with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Arbor Elf. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Elder Gargaroth and Klothys, God of Destiny, to control the board and apply pressure. Additionally, there are versatile planeswalkers like Chandra, Torch of Defiance and Nahiri, the Harbinger, for card advantage and removal. The deck aims to control the game tempo and outvalue opponents with a mix of disruption and threats.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent in order to win the game as fast as possible. It contains a mix of creatures like Goblin Guide, Eidolon of the Great Revel, and Monastery Swiftspear along with instant burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Boros Charm, and Rift Bolt. The deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent and finish them off before they have a chance to stabilize or mount a defense. It relies on fast, efficient plays to overwhelm the opponent and secure a swift victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Narcomoeba, and then bring back powerful creatures like Bloodghast and Prized Amalgam with cards like Life from the Loam and Conflagrate. The deck utilizes the Dredge mechanic to continuously fill up the graveyard and trigger powerful effects such as Creeping Chill. The aim is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures and burn spells, utilizing the graveyard as a resource to win the game.

The key theme of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy focused on Human creatures. By utilizing cards like Champion of the Parish, Mantis Rider, and Thalia's Lieutenant, the deck aims to build a strong board presence quickly. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Reflector Mage disrupt the opponent's plans, while Aether Vial accelerates creature deployment. The deck's mana base, including Cavern of Souls and Unclaimed Territory, allows for consistent casting of its Human creatures. Overall, the deck seeks to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent through efficient creature plays.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive creatures and efficient removal spells. By utilizing low-cost, high-powered creatures such as Wild Nacatl, Steppe Lynx, and Brushfire Elemental, along with various landfall triggers, the deck can deal damage swiftly. Additionally, Wrenn and Six provide valuable recursion for lands and removal spells, while the inclusion of Lightning Bolt and Lightning Helix offer additional reach and removal. The deck's efficient mana base enables consistent and explosive starts, allowing it to apply pressure early in the game.

The main concept of this Modern Aggro Red Deck Wins archetype is to quickly and efficiently deal damage to the opponent using low-cost creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Soul-Scar Mage, Monastery Swiftspear, and Bedlam Reveler, along with a mix of direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Dart, and Lava Spike, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish a strong board presence. Drawing cards with Light Up the Stage and filtering through the deck with Mishra's Bauble and Manamorphose also help maintain consistency and pressure.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing the player to drop powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Karn Liberated, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes various control elements like Oblivion Stone and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to stabilize the board, ramp up mana production, and eventually overwhelm the opponent with big threats that are difficult to deal with.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and drawing cards until it can stabilize and win the game with powerful planeswalkers such as Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. It focuses on maintaining a balance between disruption and card advantage, using cards like Cryptic Command, Force of Negation, and Snapcaster Mage to control the board while generating incremental advantage with cards like Opt and Archmage's Charm. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent and eventually overpower them with its powerful threats.

Utilizing a mixture of countermagic, removal, and efficient creatures, this deck aims to control the game through disrupting the opponent's strategy while developing its own board presence. By leveraging powerful cards such as Snapcaster Mage and Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck seeks to outvalue the opponent and dominate the battlefield. Stoneforge Mystic helps to search for key equipment pieces like Batterskull and Sword of Feast and Famine to further enhance its creatures. With a blend of tempo plays and card advantage, this UWx Midrange deck looks to outmaneuver its opponents and come out ahead in the late game.
